On Apr 11, 2008, at 9:38 PM, Kenneth Stanley wrote:
> Jason Gauci and I are pleased to share with you new results with
> HyperNEAT  in our new paper to appear in the Twenty-Third AAAI
> Conference on Artificial Intelligence (2008), "A Case Study on the
> Critical Role of Geometric Regularity in Machine Learning."


Cool, I enjoyed the paper, thanks Jason and Ken.

I have a few questions:

* Was the 4in/2out CPPN arbitrarily chosen?
* Why not a 6in/1out (xyz, xyz, out) - which seems more natural to me?
* Was more than one CPPN configuration tried?  What was the process?
* Was more than one substrate configuration tried?  ...
* What was the full connection pattern through the substrate?  You  
mention the 129 nodes (which makes sense), but what are the 3979  
connections?
* Did you try against any opponents other than Xcheckers?
* Have you experimented with coevolution?

Thanks again for the great work.
--
Stephen Waits
steve@...
http://swaits.com/
